solution_line_template: Two schools can teach {capacity_school_group1} students, so in total, they can teach {num_schools_group1} * {capacity_school_group1} = <<{num_schools_group1}*{capacity_school_group1}={total_capacity_group1}>>{total_capacity_group1} students.

The other two schools can teach {capacity_school_group2} students, which gives {num_schools_group2} * {capacity_school_group2} = <<{num_schools_group2}*{capacity_school_group2}={total_capacity_group2}>>{total_capacity_group2} students in total.

So all four schools can teach {total_capacity_group1} + {total_capacity_group2} = <<{total_capacity_group1}+{total_capacity_group2}={total_capacity_all_schools}>>{total_capacity_all_schools} students at a time.
